file_content.text: My lord. I hope you don't find my appearance here obtrusive. I beg an audience.
I will always welcome you, Quinn.
Anytime.
It pleases me to know that, my lord.
Begging does not become an officer.
Be dignified.
Pardon my word choice, my lord. I will speak plainly.
I'd hoped I'd seen the last of you.
Not you again.
My apologies, my lord. Perhaps my presence is unwelcome, but I hope to remedy that.
As you know, Lord Baras enabled my reassignment anywhere I choose. It is an evolution I've longed for and assumed would never come.
Aiding your mission on this planet has reawakened the ambition I began my career with--to make the most profound impact possible for the Empire.
We share the same desire, Captain.
Great minds think alike.
I sense that as well, my lord.
Welcome back to life, Quinn.
Glad to hear it.
That is how it feels, my lord.
Good luck with that.
Whatever you say.
I don't want to leave it to luck, my lord.
I cannot think of a more glorious and honorable way to make a difference in the galaxy than to serve you.
I'm here to pledge myself to you. I'm ready and willing to serve in whatever capacity you see fit.
An intriguing idea, Quinn.
Interesting.
Yeah, I'm so intrigued I could yawn.
Yeah, let him join up. The more, the merrier.
Whatever capacity I see fit? How exciting.
[Flirt] Very interesting.
More like nauseating.
I wouldn't expect a child to understand.
It's over your head.
Yeah, we could use a man around here.
What exactly can you do, Captain?
What are your qualifications?
Who cares what he can do. I could use some help around here.
I'm considering it, Vette.
Perhaps.
There are some things only you can do for me, Vette.
But you'll always be special.
You can say that again. You're nearly useless.
Sure could.
You should be so lucky.
You wish.
Yeah, I recommend the experience.
More like cursed.
Please, not now, Vette.
Save it.
You always keep me laughing, Vette.
You're funny.
She thinks she's funny.
That's bad Twi'lek humor.
Shut up, slave.
Quiet! [Shock Vette]
My lord, if given the chance, I know I will prove myself to you.
I'm a top-notch pilot, military strategist and a deadly shot. I can fly this ship, plan your battles, assess your enemies and kill them.
You won't find a more tireless and loyal subject. I offer my military prowess and dedicate every ounce of my strength to your cause.
I would be pleased to have you, Quinn.
Sounds good.
The pleasure will be mine.
All right, I'll find something for you to do.
You'll fit in somewhere.
An opportunity is all I ask.
I'll use you as a human shield.
You'll be my fodder.
If that's what the situation demands, I will do my duty.
Thank you, my lord. I will submit my reassignment papers as we depart.
It's not my place, Lord Baras. I leave that for your apprentice to convey.
Then step aside, Lieutenant. My apprentice has arrived.
Nice of you to join us. Quinn refuses to update me, insisting the privilege be yours. I assume the Jedi investigator has been stopped?
She is no longer a concern, master.
I handled it.
I've captured her for you to torture.
She's in custody.
Excellent thinking, apprentice. Hopefully, she will provide us with more insight into Nomen Karr's Padawan.
I look forward to getting my hands on her. The lieutenant will arrange the transport.
She is dead, master.
Stopped permanently.
That is a relief.
Quinn killed her transmission, and I killed her.
With Quinn's help.
Your carelessness created a crisis... but since you quelled it, we can move on.
I handled it. Your doubts and worries are becoming intolerable.
Of course. Give me a break.
Considering recent developments, yes, I had much concern.
I had hoped to avoid confronting the Jedi, but our hand was forced. What matters most is that Rylon can no longer be exposed.
And how would you assess Lieutenant Quinn's contribution?
He did his part.
Adequate.
Lieutenant Quinn is an exceptional officer. I couldn't have done it without him.
He was vital to me.
High praise indeed. Quinn, I believe you have sufficiently repaid the debt owed to me.
He was along for the ride.
Didn't need him.
Lieutenant, my apprentice's demeanor notwithstanding, I have been impressed with your efforts. You have more than made up what is owed to me.
I'm putting you up for a captaincy and transmitting an executive order allowing you to station wherever you choose. You are dismissed.
Thank you, Lord Baras. If my actions benefit the Empire, they benefit me. I would have done the same regardless of our past.
My lord, before I depart, it's been my extreme honor to serve you. You are the epitome of everything the Empire stands for.
The honor has been mine, Captain.
It's been a pleasure.
I'm going to miss your rugged good looks, Quinn.
[Flirt] Not so bad yourself.
Maybe our paths will cross once more, my lord.
Thank you for noticing, Quinn.
You're observant.
You've been dismissed, Imperial.
Get going.
Until we meet again. I salute you, my lord.
He will have his hands full. There are powerful Imperials dedicated to keeping him down.
But if Quinn can overcome them and rise to the station he deserves, there is great hope for our Imperial allies.
If given the opportunity, he will excel.
I expect much from him.
Either way, it's not worth worrying about. Quinn's affairs are a speck compared to what we face.
Maybe we should assist him.
Can we help?
I have no time for such needling dramas.
Can we get on with our business?
Who cares?
You are quite right, apprentice. Quinn's fate is of small consequence compared to our affairs.
Your presence on Balmorra is no longer needed. Return to your ship when you're ready to leave. I'll contact you there.
So... we're leaving, right? On to our next exercise in domination and destruction?
It would seem so, Vette.
That's right.
We don't have to leave to have an exercise in domination.
[Shock Vette]
Ahh! Okay, okay, point taken!
Sure hope the next place we land on has a place to buy painkillers.
I only dominate and destroy as a last resort.
Don't mischaracterize me.
Yeah, right. You must have a short list of resorts, then.
I know, I know. It's one of the most surprising things about you.
Domination and destruction are my favorite pastimes.
Hopefully.
It's nice to enjoy what you're good at.
Well, hope the next place we end up at has a beach.
My lord, I believe we've got trouble. I heard your entire conversation with Commander Rylon.
How could you hear my conversation? Have you been spying on me, Imperial?
How is that possible?
No, my lord. As I told you, I've been surveilling the Jedi investigator.
I'm listening.
What from my conversation makes you think we have trouble?
So what?
I told you that I've had the Jedi investigator surveilled and that she's been snooping around the Arms Factory.
Apparently, she bugged Rylon's quarters, and as she listened in on your conversation, I heard what she heard. The investigator knows everything, my lord.
Where is she now?
Direct me to her.
That is the worst possible news, Lieutenant.
I'm not pleased.
All is not lost, my lord.
The same can be said of you now.
She's not the only one.
Yes, but I pose no risk to Lord Baras. If this investigator gets away, she'll expose everything.
She was heading to her ship, but I had my men move in and cut her off from the Republic landing bay.
I am systematically blocking her avenues of transmission and escape, herding that Republic scum to her only hope--the spaceport at Sobrik.
If she escapes, I'm holding you accountable.
This is your fault.
Then I will make certain that doesn't occur.
I'll head her off.
I'm afraid there's more, my lord. My men who engaged her report that she's wielding a lightsaber.
It seems this investigator is a Jedi Knight. I advise caution when facing her.
How does she expect to survive an Imperial spaceport?
Sobrik is our territory.
My men report that she's wielding a lightsaber, my lord. This investigator is a Jedi Knight.
Unless you stop her, she's more than capable of fighting her way through the spaceport and commandeering a ship.
I'll be able to delay the Jedi long enough for you to engage. But I advise caution when facing her.
Being careful is what got us into this mess.
Time for caution has passed.
I see your point, my lord.
Excellent. Today, I kill a Jedi Knight.
About time I faced a Jedi.
Killing Jedi is old hat for me.
I've faced her kind before.
Then my concern is unfounded. My apologies.
Keep your advice to yourself, Imperial.
I don't need your input.
Yes, my lord.
I will gather my remaining men and meet you at the spaceport. We will crush this Jedi!
Your final directive is within your grasp, my lord. I trust you'll be heading to the Balmorran Arms Factory soon.
Lord Baras still awaits your call from the holo in my main barracks. The room is yours.
Lord Baras is pleased. He says it's time to zero in on your prime directive, and he awaits your contact.
My barracks are yours. Activate the holocommunicator in the next room to speak with Lord Baras. The line is secure.
Don't wander off.
Stay put.
I'll be right here if needed, my lord.
Thank you.
I'll call Baras when I'm good and ready.
At my whim.
Whenever it pleases you, my lord. Make yourself comfortable.
I must be honest--your success at the satellite control station and Republic crater outpost has surprised me, my lord.
I computed the likelihood of success as nearly negligible. In my assessment, however, I only considered the capabilities of a typical Sith.
Clearly, you are not a typical Sith. I will adjust future calibrations to account for your unprecedented abilities.
If anything, you should overestimate my capabilities.
Good idea.
If you don't mind, I'm going to attempt to be as accurate as possible.
Don't worry about it, Quinn.
No sweat.
I take pride in accuracy. Otherwise, I'm no good to you.
Quinn, you know just what to say.
[Flirt] Music to my ears.
I'm not too proud to acknowledge when I'm mistaken.
Don't let it happen again, Imperial.
I don't like mistakes.
You'll find my learning curve to be exceptionally responsive.
My lord, Ensign Durmat is being detained in the brig of the Republic crater outpost, awaiting questioning by the mysterious agent Baras has me tracking.
I will alert you if the investigator appears to be heading there. I assume you wish to get to Durmat before she does.
You assume correctly, Lieutenant.
That's right.
Then I won't delay you any longer.
It's none of your business, Imperial.
Curiosity killed the reekcat.
I apologize, my lord. My inquiring mind often gets the best of me. I won't delay you any longer.
What can you tell me about the mysterious agent?
How is your tracking going?
She appears to be investigating one of the Republic's own--a Commander Rylon. I'm instructed to keep close tabs but stay out of her way.
I've managed to slice the security you'll need to breach the crater outpost. Transmitting it now.
Good luck on your mission, my lord. I'll be here if you need anything.
My lord, I mark your progress, and see that the charge is armed. I will detonate once you are at a safe distance.
But first, I have Darth Baras on holo for you. I will retreat and leave the line secure for the two of you.
Apprentice, we have one more potentially compromising thing to take care of before you can confront my spy Commander Rylon.
It involves invading a Republic keep to find a lowly ensign named Durmat.
He is Rylon's son, and the commander confided his true identity to him. Ensign Durmat must be silenced, permanently.
Rylon was foolish to tell his son.
That was stupid of him.
The one chink in his otherwise flawless armor.
Maybe the son can be trusted?
Is Durmat a security risk?
I don't leave loose ends. And all indications are that Rylon's son is a very loose end.
It will be my pleasure. I'll make sure he never talks.
The ensign will die.
I'll signal Quinn to give you the details. Be swift.
I will be waiting for your contact once your siege of the satellite control tower is complete
My lord, I've prepared what you need for your assault on the satellite control tower.
In order to destroy the mainframe, you'll mount this charge to the base and activate it. Then contact me and I'll be able to detonate.
Sir, I apologize, sir! It was the best I could do.
If that's your best, you're useless to me. I can shoot you dead with a clear conscience. Is that what you want?
N--no, sir!
Then focus, Jillins. Dismissed.
I apologize for the delay, my lord. Lieutenant Malavai Quinn. I'm to be your liaison here on Balmorra.
Darth Baras says you're capable. I hope he's not mistaken.
You better be ready.
I will earn that distinction, my lord.
Well met, Lieutenant.
And to you, my lord.
You say "liaison," I say "servant."
More like my lackey.
Yes. I am in your charge for as long as you are on this planet.
Lord Baras will brief you personally, but I'm to acquaint you with the climate here on Balmorra first.
I don't have all day, Lieutenant.
Do it quickly.
I won't mince words, my lord.
Proceed.
I'll figure Balmorra out on my own. Just cut to the chase.
Skip the briefing.
Of course, my lord.
Even though the Empire wrestled control of Balmorra from the Republic during the war, we were never able to completely eradicate them.
There is a rather sizable resistance movement. No one wants to admit it, but it's clear that the Republic is backing it.
The Republic cannot be tolerated.
They must be crushed.
I agree, my lord. It is my dream to see our enemy vanquished.
Maybe I'll have time to do something about that.
I'd like to help.
Something tells me your presence here will leave an indelible impression on the state of things. And I look forward to it.
Your local troubles do not concern me.
I don't care.
Of course, I'm sure your work here has much farther reaching consequences. Time must not be wasted.
I have a secure line to Lord Baras. I'll patch him through immediately.
Ah, I see you've convened with my apprentice. Very good, Lieutenant. Leave us.
Quinn owes his career to me, but we should keep the details of your mission between the two of us.
We must act swiftly. Nomen Karr's Padawan has directed the Jedi's suspicions to my undercover spy there on Balmorra. Do you recall this?
Of course, I remember everything.
Yes, master.
Good. I'll get to the point.
Remind me who this Nomen Karr is.
Nomen Karr?
Jedi Master Nomen Karr is my personal nemesis. He has dedicated his life to proving that there are Sith spies among the Jedi and Republic.
He is training a young Padawan who has the power to know the true nature of any being. This Padawan must be stopped.
Tell me again about this Padawan.
Padawan?
We tortured a Republic agent and learned of the existence of a Jedi Padawan under the tutelage of my nemesis, Master Nomen Karr.
This Padawan has the ability to know the true nature of any being. She sensed darkness in my spy on Balmorra.
Thus far, the Jedi are skeptical of her power. But if his Padawan is validated, Nomen Karr will have the weapon he needs to destroy everything I have built.
I will not let that happen.
Not on my watch.
Do I sense fear in you, master?
Afraid?
Only a fool is placid when faced with a true threat. As long as it does not destroy you, fear can be useful, apprentice.
What's the pertinence?
Your physical distance from me is making you bold. You should rethink that attitude.
My spy is Commander Rylon of the Republic resistance. He is the central contact for all my operatives in this sector.
Unfortunately, Quinn is tracking an investigator that the Jedi have sent. That means we have to cover our tracks before you kill Rylon.
Your first mandate is to destroy evidence that links Rylon to the sabotaging of Balmorra's defense systems during the war.
To do so, you must break into the satellite control tower. Quinn reports that the tower is a death trap of mechanical security.
That won't stop me.
Why can't the lieutenant do that?
Send Quinn.
Don't second guess me. If I thought Imperials could handle this, I wouldn't be bothering you with it.
This task is priority one. The Jedi's investigator could be zeroing in the evidence as we speak.
Are there any special requirements?
What's needed?
Quinn has everything you'll need. I'll summon him back. Remember, he is not to know the reason for your mission. I'll be in touch.
I've intercepted Republic communications about your invasion of the crater outpost. The satellite tower awaits.
My scouts informed me of your success at the satellite control tower. The crater outpost awaits.
Lord Baras will want a progress report on the satellite tower and Republic crater outpost.
This will be child's play.
Sounds easy.
Lord Baras knows your capabilities, so I've calculated the odds of a successful assault on the tower are quite low, my lord.
I told Lord Baras as much, but he didn't seem concerned.
Lord Baras is familiar with what I can do; you are not.
He knows my capabilities.
Are you challenging my master's competence?
You think Baras is reckless?
Baras always risks my neck with very little regard.
He expects miracles.
I don't want to go up in smoke. Be sure you give me a few minutes to make my escape.
Wait until I'm clear.
Of course, my lord. This isn't my first mission.
